column4: hello all, i've just swapped out ubuntu server 804 out of an old p2 400 into a Socket 7 500 amd.. ubuntu doesn't like it on boot.. says wrong kernal.. is it possible load the correct kernal?
yes, I'm about to do that, too. What's the problem you're trying to solve?
i've just changed the hdd out of an old pentium 400 to an AMD socket 7, upon boot it states it doesnn;'t like the kernal as parimiters are missing
is there anyway to get it to boot the correct kernal?
what system is installed on that HDD?
the server kernel should support either CPU. Can you be a bit more explicit about the error message. Use the pastebin if necessary
shall do, are you going to be around for a few minutes?
yes, I'll ask my question in the meantime
I can't claim I understand this error, but if your CPU is an AMD Athlon XP, I don't see why the hardy server kernel wouldn't boot
so can you make sure it is that one you are trying to boot pls
can you boot a live CD on that system?
just tried an old smoothwall in it and it worked fine
